page.title: netPanzer - An Online Multiplayer Tactical Warfare Game

subsection.title: Linux
subsection.p: Some linux distributions already come with netPanzer packages by default. You might just be able to install netPanzer with your distributions software setup tool. This is true for at least the following distributions

subsubsection.title: RPM
subsubsection.p:
rpm files for Suse and Fedora distributions can be found at the
netPanzer download section.
SuSE packages provided by Sander Erkamp aka Storm panux@2itb.com.
Fedora packages provided by Daniel Pereda aka pegardan dannyedu@adinet.com.uy.

subsubsection.title: Debian
subsubsection.p:
If you're using Debian unstable (Sid), you can add the following line to your /etc/apt/sources.list file:
deb http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main
then run apt-get update && apt-get install netpanzer.
Debian packages provided by Bartosz Fenski aka fEnIo fenio@o2.pl

subsection.title: Windows
subsection.p: Windows version provided by Matthias Braun matze@braunis.de (binary) along with Bartosz Fenski aka fEnIo fenio@o2.pl (installer).

subsection.title: MacOSX
subsection.p: Currently netPanzer code does not work correctly on big-endian machines like PPC. However we're trying to fix this for future versions. Help in this area is welcome.

subsection.title: Source Code
subsection.p: You need both the gamedata and the source if you want to compile yourself, in addition you need Jam, PhysicsFS, libxml, SDL, SDL_net, SDL_mixer, SDL_image and SDL_ttf, see the README for details.
Older releases and other files are available via the Berlios's Filelist.

subsubsection.title: CVS
subsubsection.p: Source Code is also available via CVS. Look at the netpanzer cvs page for details.
